elements.description:
`furo-api-fetch`

furo-api-fetch can be used for network requests via FETCH API with implemented fallback to XMLHttpRequest

```html
<furo-api-fetch ƒ-invoke-request="" ƒ-abort-request=""></furo-api-fetch>
```

properties.name: lastRequest
properties.description:
LastRequest's response.

Note that lastResponse is set when ongoing request finishes, so if loading is true,
then lastResponse will correspond to the result of the previous request.

properties.name: xhrFallback
properties.description: True if fetch API is not available

methods.name: invokeRequest
methods.description: Sends a HTTP request to the server

params.name: request
params.description: (The Request interface of the Fetch API represents a resource request.) https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request

methods.name: abortRequest
methods.description:
Aborts a pending request
You have to submit an AbortController

params.name: controller
params.description:
(The AbortController interface represents a controller object that allows you to abort one or more DOM requests as and when desired.)
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AbortController

methods.name: _executeRequest
methods.description:
Requests are made via the Fetch API if possible.
Fallback XMLHttpRequest

**payload** request object

methods.name: _invokeXHR
methods.description: Requests are made via fallback XMLHttpRequest

methods.name: _reworkRequest
methods.description:
Errorhandling according to Google rest-api-v3 Status Codes
(https://developers.google.com/maps-booking/reference/rest-api-v3/status_codes)

Dispatches event `response-error` and a specific error event with status code

methods.name: _parseResponse
methods.description:
parses response object according to lastRequest heaader informationen `content-type`
you will find the supported content-types in the declaration area
respone Fetch API response object [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response]
Default response handler is json!

elements.name: FuroApiFetch

events.name: fatal-error
events.description:
Requests are made via the Fetch API if possible.
Fallback XMLHttpRequest

*payload** request object

events.name: request-aborted
events.description:
Fired when a request was canceled.
Payload: request

events.name: request-started
events.description:
Fired when a request is sent.
Payload: request

events.name: response
events.description:
Fired when a response is received.
Here you will get the parsed response
Format depends on request header `content-type`
supported types:
- text/plain
- application/json
- image/jpeg (Blob)
- application/octet-stream (ArrayBuffer)
- application/pdf (Blob)

Payload: parsed response

events.name: response-error
events.description:
Fired when an error has occoured.
This is a general error event. The specific error events are fired additionally.

events.name: response-error-[status-code]
events.description:
Fired when an error has occoured.
This is a specific error event.

events.name: response-raw
events.description:
Fired when a response is received.
Here you will get the raw response object
Payload: Raw response

elements.description:
`furo-collection-agent` is an interface component to handle collection requests. It helps you with paginating collection data.




How to use:
```html
<furo-collection-agent ƒ-hts-in="--x"
                     service=""
                     ƒ-prev-page=""
                     ƒ-next-page=""
                     ƒ-last-page=""
                     ƒ-first-page=""
                     ƒ-list="--triggerGetCollection"
                     ƒ-hts-in="--hts"
                     list-on-hts-in

properties.name: service
properties.description: The service name. Like ProjectService

methods.name: _attachListeners
methods.description: Attaches temporary listeners to fire load-success, load-fail, delete-success,...

methods.name: setFields
methods.description:
Partielle Repräsentation
https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/design_patterns#partial_response

etwas seltsam, aber google sieht hier $fields vor. Wird aber nicht so verwendet

methods.name: setOrderBy
methods.description:
Sortierreihenfolge
https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/design_patterns#sorting_order

To avoid sql injection errors we do not send sql like syntax!

order-by="foo,-bar"  means foo asc and bar desc

methods.name: clearFilter
methods.description: clear filter

methods.name: setFilter
methods.description: Filtern  [["user","eq","12345"], ["abgeschlossen","eq", true]]

methods.name: updateQp
methods.description:
Update query params
a qp like {"active":true} will just update the qp *active*

If the current value of the qp is not the same like the injected value, a qp-changed event will be fired

methods.name: list
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.name: first
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.name: prev
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.name: next
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.name: last
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

elements.name: furoCollectionAgent

events.name: ALL_BUBBLING_EVENTS_FROM_furo-api-fetch
events.description:
ALL_BUBBLING_EVENTS_FROM_furo-api-fetch

All bubbling events from [furo-api-fetch](furo-api-fetch) will be fired, because furo-collection-agent uses furo-api-fetch internally.

filter-updated
Fired when filter was updated with ƒ-set-filter

hts-updated

detail payload: Hateoas links

events.description:
qp-changed
Fired when query params changed
detail payload: qp

response-hts-updated
Fired when
detail payload: hts

methods.description: Auto append fbp for lit elements

methods.name: _FBPTriggerWire
methods.description: Triggers a wire

methods.name: _FBPTraceWires
methods.description:
Log all triggered wires for this component. This function may help you at debugging.
Select your element in the dev console and call `$0._FBPTraceWires()`

methods.name: _FBPDebug
methods.description:
Get information for the triggered wire. This function may help you at debugging.
Select your element in the dev console and call `$0._FBPDebug('--dataReceived')`

params.name: openDebugger
params.description: opens the debugger console, so you can inspect your component.

methods.name: _appendFBP
methods.description: parses the dom for flowbased programming tags

methods.name: _FBPReady
methods.description:
Livecycle method
This method is called, when the wires are ready

methods.name: _pathGet
methods.description:
Reads a value from a path.  If any sub-property in the path is `undefined`,
this method returns `undefined` (will never throw.

params.name: root
params.description: Object from which to dereference path from

return.desc:
Value at path, or `undefined` if the path could not be
 fully dereferenced.

methods.name: _pathSet
methods.description:
Sets a value to a path.  If any sub-property in the path is `undefined`,
this method will no-op.

params.name: root
params.description: Object from which to dereference path from

return.desc: The normalized version of the input path

methods.name: _split
methods.description:
Splits a path into an array of property names. Accepts either arrays
of path parts or strings.

Example:

```
split(['foo.bar', 0, 'baz'])  // ['foo', 'bar', '0', 'baz']
split('foo.bar.0.baz')        // ['foo', 'bar', '0', 'baz']
```

return.desc: Array of path parts

methods.name: trigger
methods.description: trigger the method with respect for binded-requset-object

methods.name: triggerWithBody
methods.description: trigger the method with data

events.name: hts-updated
events.description:
hts-updated
Fired when
detail payload:

elements.description:
`furo-data-object` gives you a object which is built based on the **type** spec.
The types must be available in the {Env}, learn more about setting up the environment in the guide.

The data will mostly be used in a [data-ui]/(../../data-input/doc) component or in component that yoh build, which contains one or more of them.

`furo-data-object` receives its data regularly from a [collection-aget](furo-collection-agent) or a  [entity-aget](furo-entity-agent).
But you can also send json data which is formed like the raw-data of this type.

`furo-data-object` will not do any validation or data manipulation neither will send the data. It is just responsible to
transform incomming data to an object and vice versa. You can access the manipulated data structure on the property
`.data.rawData` with javascript (if needed).

```html
 <!-- The furo-data-object will send a initial dataObject of type project.Project on @-response-ready -->
 <furo-data-object type="project.Project" ƒ-inject-raw="--response(*.data)" @-object-ready="--dataObject"></furo-data-object>

 <!-- The furo-entity-agent will fetch the data from ProjectService and pass it in @-response to the furo-data-object.  -->
 <furo-entity-agent service="ProjectService" ƒ-save="--saveClicked" ƒ-bind-request-data="--dataObject" @-response="--response" ></furo-entity-agent>
```

properties.name: updateComplete
properties.description:
Returns a Promise that resolves when the element has completed updating.
The Promise value is a boolean that is `true` if the element completed the
update without triggering another update. The Promise result is `false` if
a property was set inside `updated()`. If the Promise is rejected, an
exception was thrown during the update.

To await additional asynchronous work, override the `_getUpdateComplete`
method. For example, it is sometimes useful to await a rendered element
before fulfilling this Promise. To do this, first await
`super._getUpdateComplete()`, then any subsequent state.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The name of the type you want to use. The type must be registered in Env

methods.name: initialize
methods.description:
Performs element initialization. By default this calls `createRenderRoot`
to create the element `renderRoot` node and captures any pre-set values for
registered properties.

methods.name: _saveInstanceProperties
methods.description:
Fixes any properties set on the instance before upgrade time.
Otherwise these would shadow the accessor and break these properties.
The properties are stored in a Map which is played back after the
constructor runs. Note, on very old versions of Safari (<=9) or Chrome
(<=41), properties created for native platform properties like (`id` or
`name`) may not have default values set in the element constructor. On
these browsers native properties appear on instances and therefore their
default value will overwrite any element default (e.g. if the element sets
this.id = 'id' in the constructor, the 'id' will become '' since this is
the native platform default).

methods.name: _applyInstanceProperties
methods.description: Applies previously saved instance properties.

methods.name: disconnectedCallback
methods.description:
Allows for `super.disconnectedCallback()` in extensions while
reserving the possibility of making non-breaking feature additions
when disconnecting at some point in the future.

methods.name: attributeChangedCallback
methods.description: Synchronizes property values when attributes change.

methods.name: _requestUpdate
methods.description:
This private version of `requestUpdate` does not access or return the
`updateComplete` promise. This promise can be overridden and is therefore
not free to access.

methods.name: requestUpdate
methods.description:
Requests an update which is processed asynchronously. This should
be called when an element should update based on some state not triggered
by setting a property. In this case, pass no arguments. It should also be
called when manually implementing a property setter. In this case, pass the
property `name` and `oldValue` to ensure that any configured property
options are honored. Returns the `updateComplete` Promise which is resolved
when the update completes.

return.desc: A Promise that is resolved when the update completes.

methods.name: _enqueueUpdate
methods.description: Sets up the element to asynchronously update.

methods.name: performUpdate
_getUpdateComplete
shouldUpdate
methods.description:
Controls whether or not `update` should be called when the element requests
an update. By default, this method always returns `true`, but this can be
customized to control when to update.

* @param _changedProperties Map of changed properties with old values

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Updates the element. This method reflects property values to attributes
and calls `render` to render DOM via lit-html. Setting properties inside
this method will *not* trigger another update.
* @param _changedProperties Map of changed properties with old values

methods.name: updated
methods.description:
Invoked whenever the element is updated. Implement to perform
post-updating tasks via DOM APIs, for example, focusing an element.

Setting properties inside this method will trigger the element to update
again after this update cycle completes.

* @param _changedProperties Map of changed properties with old values

methods.name: firstUpdated
methods.description:
Invoked when the element is first updated. Implement to perform one time
work on the element after update.

Setting properties inside this method will trigger the element to update
again after this update cycle completes.

* @param _changedProperties Map of changed properties with old values

methods.name: createRenderRoot
methods.description:
Returns the node into which the element should render and by default
creates and returns an open shadowRoot. Implement to customize where the
element's DOM is rendered. For example, to render into the element's
childNodes, return `this`.

return.desc: Returns a node into which to render.

methods.name: adoptStyles
methods.description:
Applies styling to the element shadowRoot using the `static get styles`
property. Styling will apply using `shadowRoot.adoptedStyleSheets` where
available and will fallback otherwise. When Shadow DOM is polyfilled,
ShadyCSS scopes styles and adds them to the document. When Shadow DOM
is available but `adoptedStyleSheets` is not, styles are appended to the
end of the `shadowRoot` to [mimic spec
behavior](https://wicg.github.io/construct-stylesheets/#using-constructed-stylesheets).

methods.name: render
methods.description:
Invoked on each update to perform rendering tasks. This method must return
a lit-html TemplateResult. Setting properties inside this method will *not*
trigger the element to update.

methods.name: injectRaw
methods.description:
inject a raw data response from the corresonding agent.

Input may look something like this:

**Entity data**
```json
 {data:{},links:[],meta{}}
```

**Collection data**
```json
 {data:{},links:[],meta{},entities:[]}
```

staticMethods.name: createProperty
staticMethods.description:
Creates a property accessor on the element prototype if one does not exist.
The property setter calls the property's `hasChanged` property option
or uses a strict identity check to determine whether or not to request
an update.

staticMethods.name: _attributeNameForProperty
staticMethods.description: Returns the property name for the given attribute `name`.

staticMethods.name: _valueHasChanged
staticMethods.description:
Returns true if a property should request an update.
Called when a property value is set and uses the `hasChanged`
option for the property if present or a strict identity check.

staticMethods.name: _propertyValueFromAttribute
staticMethods.description:
Returns the property value for the given attribute value.
Called via the `attributeChangedCallback` and uses the property's
`converter` or `converter.fromAttribute` property option.

staticMethods.name: _propertyValueToAttribute
staticMethods.description:
Returns the attribute value for the given property value. If this
returns undefined, the property will *not* be reflected to an attribute.
If this returns null, the attribute will be removed, otherwise the
attribute will be set to the value.
This uses the property's `reflect` and `type.toAttribute` property options.

elements.name: FuroDataObject

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The name of the type you want to use. The type must be registered in Env

data-changed

*bubbles**

events.name: data-injected

data-injected
Fired when injected data was processed.

*detail payload**: {Object|EntityNode} reference to entity

*bubbles**

events.name: object-ready
events.description:
object-ready
Fired when the object is built (based on the type).

*detail payload:** A EntityNode object

*bubbles**

methods.description: set queryParams and evaluate for hateoas

methods.name: injectQueryParams
methods.description:
Deprecated

use ƒ-qp-in instead

Inject a QueryParams (key value) Object

methods.name: setService
methods.description:
Sets the service

Services must be registered like:

```html
import {Services,Types} from "./apiConfig.js"
Init.registerApiServices(Services);
Init.registerApiTypes(Types);
```
Usually this is done in your main-app.js

params.description: Object from which to dereference path from

return.desc: The normalized version of the input path

methods.name: _split
methods.description:
Splits a path into an array of property names. Accepts either arrays
of path parts or strings.

Example:

```
split(['foo.bar', 0, 'baz'])  // ['foo', 'bar', '0', 'baz']
split('foo.bar.0.baz')        // ['foo', 'bar', '0', 'baz']
```

return.desc: Array of path parts

elements.name: FuroEntityValidator

elements.description:
Use this component to interact with fields from an furo-data-object.

You can set the field value or listen to changes of a field.

properties.name: updateComplete
properties.description:
Returns a Promise that resolves when the element has completed updating.
The Promise value is a boolean that is `true` if the element completed the
update without triggering another update. The Promise result is `false` if
a property was set inside `updated()`. If the Promise is rejected, an
exception was thrown during the update.

To await additional asynchronous work, override the `_getUpdateComplete`
method. For example, it is sometimes useful to await a rendered element
before fulfilling this Promise. To do this, first await
`super._getUpdateComplete()`, then any subsequent state.

methods.name: initialize
methods.description:
Performs element initialization. By default this calls `createRenderRoot`
to create the element `renderRoot` node and captures any pre-set values for
registered properties.

methods.name: _saveInstanceProperties
methods.description:
Fixes any properties set on the instance before upgrade time.
Otherwise these would shadow the accessor and break these properties.
The properties are stored in a Map which is played back after the
constructor runs. Note, on very old versions of Safari (<=9) or Chrome
(<=41), properties created for native platform properties like (`id` or
`name`) may not have default values set in the element constructor. On
these browsers native properties appear on instances and therefore their
default value will overwrite any element default (e.g. if the element sets
this.id = 'id' in the constructor, the 'id' will become '' since this is
the native platform default).

methods.name: _applyInstanceProperties
methods.description: Applies previously saved instance properties.

methods.name: attributeChangedCallback
methods.description: Synchronizes property values when attributes change.

methods.name: _requestUpdate
methods.description:
This private version of `requestUpdate` does not access or return the
`updateComplete` promise. This promise can be overridden and is therefore
not free to access.

methods.name: requestUpdate
methods.description:
Requests an update which is processed asynchronously. This should
be called when an element should update based on some state not triggered
by setting a property. In this case, pass no arguments. It should also be
called when manually implementing a property setter. In this case, pass the
property `name` and `oldValue` to ensure that any configured property
options are honored. Returns the `updateComplete` Promise which is resolved
when the update completes.

return.desc: A Promise that is resolved when the update completes.

methods.name: _enqueueUpdate
methods.description: Sets up the element to asynchronously update.

methods.name: performUpdate
_getUpdateComplete
shouldUpdate
methods.description:
Controls whether or not `update` should be called when the element requests
an update. By default, this method always returns `true`, but this can be
customized to control when to update.

* @param _changedProperties Map of changed properties with old values

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Updates the element. This method reflects property values to attributes
and calls `render` to render DOM via lit-html. Setting properties inside
this method will *not* trigger another update.
* @param _changedProperties Map of changed properties with old values

methods.name: updated
methods.description:
Invoked whenever the element is updated. Implement to perform
post-updating tasks via DOM APIs, for example, focusing an element.

Setting properties inside this method will trigger the element to update
again after this update cycle completes.

* @param _changedProperties Map of changed properties with old values

methods.name: firstUpdated
methods.description: Auto append fbp for lit elements

methods.name: createRenderRoot
methods.description:
Returns the node into which the element should render and by default
creates and returns an open shadowRoot. Implement to customize where the
element's DOM is rendered. For example, to render into the element's
childNodes, return `this`.

return.desc: Returns a node into which to render.

methods.name: adoptStyles
methods.description:
Applies styling to the element shadowRoot using the `static get styles`
property. Styling will apply using `shadowRoot.adoptedStyleSheets` where
available and will fallback otherwise. When Shadow DOM is polyfilled,
ShadyCSS scopes styles and adds them to the document. When Shadow DOM
is available but `adoptedStyleSheets` is not, styles are appended to the
end of the `shadowRoot` to [mimic spec
behavior](https://wicg.github.io/construct-stylesheets/#using-constructed-stylesheets).

methods.name: render
methods.description:
Invoked on each update to perform rendering tasks. This method must return
a lit-html TemplateResult. Setting properties inside this method will *not*
trigger the element to update.

methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description: Auto append fbp for Polymer

methods.name: _FBPTriggerWire
methods.description: Triggers a wire

methods.name: _FBPTraceWires
methods.description:
Log all triggered wires for this component. This function may help you at debugging.
Select your element in the dev console and call `$0._FBPTraceWires()`

methods.name: _FBPDebug
methods.description:
Get information for the triggered wire. This function may help you at debugging.
Select your element in the dev console and call `$0._FBPDebug('--dataReceived')`

params.description: opens the debugger console, so you can inspect your component.

methods.name: _FBPReady
methods.description:
Livecycle method
This method is called, when the wires are ready

methods.name: _pathGet
methods.description:
Reads a value from a path.  If any sub-property in the path is `undefined`,
this method returns `undefined` (will never throw.

params.name: root
params.description: Object from which to dereference path from

return.desc:
Value at path, or `undefined` if the path could not be
 fully dereferenced.

methods.name: _pathSet
methods.description:
Sets a value to a path.  If any sub-property in the path is `undefined`,
this method will no-op.

params.name: root
params.description: Object from which to dereference path from

return.desc: The normalized version of the input path

methods.name: _split
methods.description:
Splits a path into an array of property names. Accepts either arrays
of path parts or strings.

Example:

```
split(['foo.bar', 0, 'baz'])  // ['foo', 'bar', '0', 'baz']
split('foo.bar.0.baz')        // ['foo', 'bar', '0', 'baz']
```

return.desc: Array of path parts

methods.name: setValue
methods.description: Set the value of the field.

methods.name: bindData
methods.description:
Bind a entity field to the date-input. You can use the entity even when no data was received.
When you use `@-object-ready` from a `furo-data-object` which emits a EntityNode, just bind the field with `--entity(*.fields.fieldname)`

staticMethods.name: createProperty
staticMethods.description:
Creates a property accessor on the element prototype if one does not exist.
The property setter calls the property's `hasChanged` property option
or uses a strict identity check to determine whether or not to request
an update.

staticMethods.name: _attributeNameForProperty
staticMethods.description: Returns the property name for the given attribute `name`.

staticMethods.name: _valueHasChanged
staticMethods.description:
Returns true if a property should request an update.
Called when a property value is set and uses the `hasChanged`
option for the property if present or a strict identity check.

staticMethods.name: _propertyValueFromAttribute
staticMethods.description:
Returns the property value for the given attribute value.
Called via the `attributeChangedCallback` and uses the property's
`converter` or `converter.fromAttribute` property option.

staticMethods.name: _propertyValueToAttribute
staticMethods.description:
Returns the attribute value for the given property value. If this
returns undefined, the property will *not* be reflected to an attribute.
If this returns null, the attribute will be removed, otherwise the
attribute will be set to the value.
This uses the property's `reflect` and `type.toAttribute` property options.

elements.description:
Converts hateoas to queryParams, which is useful for routing with app-flow


```
<furo-reverse-deep-link
     service="tasks"
     rel="self" @-converted="--queryParams"
     ƒ-convert="--rawEntityOrCollection, --linksArray, --linkObject"
></furo-reverse-deep-link>
```

Broadcast the event to node and all childNodes and their childNodes
Bubbling is ignored, but propagation can be stopped

methods.description: Injecten eines raw models wie bspw body oder entity einer collection

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resete zum letzten injectet state zurück

methods.name: init
methods.description: Inits the EntityNode without breaking the reference

methods.description: Returns a json representation of your Data Object

methods.name: _initFieldsFromSpec
methods.description: Baut die Felder aufgrund der spec auf
